trial_identification.studytitle: A Randomised, Cross-over Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Tolerability of FLX-787 in Patients with Multiple Sclerosis spasticity and spasms/cramps
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised, Cross-over Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Tolerability of FLX-787 in Patients with Multiple Sclerosis spasticity and spasms/cramps

conditions.healthcondition: Spasticity & cramps in patients with MS

interventions.interventions: Eligible Subjects will enter the study and commence the Enrolment Period 1, a 14-day period during which all Subjects will receive capsules, the capsules will be consumed twice daily, one in the morning and once in the evening. Upon completion of Period 1, Subjects who remain eligible will be randomised to one of two possible treatment sequences (Inactive Control FLX-787 or FLX-787 Inactive Control). FLX-787 or Inactive Control are both oral beverages which will be taken twice daily for one of two 14-day Cross-over Periods. Self-administration will take place in the morning approximately within an hour of rising and in the evening approximately 45 minutes before going to bed. Subjects will be allocated to each treatment sequence in a 1:1 ratio. There will be a 7-14 day Wash-out Period between Period 1 and Period 2. Each Cross-over Period (Periods 2 and 3) is 14 days. There will be a 7-14 day Wash-out Period between Periods 2 and 3. Assessments will be performed and surveys will be completed at each clinic visit according to the study events flow chart. In addition to the in-clinic assessments, Subjects will be completing daily telephone surveys through an Interactive Voice Response System (IVRS) to document information on the previous days muscle spasms/cramps (including number of, time, duration, location, and pain level), the level of spasticity according to the NRS and study product compliance. Subjects will return to the centre for an End of Treatment Visit (or Early Termination Visit if they withdraw before the end of the study). In addition, a follow-up telephone interview to assess adverse events (AEs) will take place 30 days after the last administration of the study product. Each clinic visit will have a +3-day visit window after the due date to account for scheduling conflicts/holidays/weekends. Subjects will be given an additional six (6) doses of study product to allow for continued dosing through the 3-day visit window if needed.
interventions.comparator: 25ml, inactive beverage consumed orally twice daily, morning and evening

primaryOutcome.outcome: The alternate primary objectives of this study are to assess the effects of FLX-787 in multiple sclerosis (MS) Subjects with spasticity and spasms/cramps as measured by: Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS); measuring muscle tone
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At screening, Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2) & Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Tardieu Scale (TS); measures muscle response to passive movement at set velocities
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At screening, Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2) & Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Numerical Rating Scale (NRS); a patient self assessment, measuring muscle spasticity on a 10 point scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At screening, Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2), Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3) and Visit 7 (drop out visit),

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Tolerability will be measured by AEs, Laboratory Evaluations and Vital Signs. AEs will be monitored and collected from the time the ICF is signed through the follow up call (30 days post last study product administration). Laboratory evaluations and vital signs will be assessed throughout the study.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At screening, Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2), Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3) and Visit 7 (drop out visit),

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Barthel Activities of Dailey living, measures performance in activities of daily living
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2) & Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Timed 25-Foot Walk; measures patients quantitative mobility and leg function
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2) & Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Clinical Global Impression; measures global rating of illness severity, improvement and response to treatment
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1) & Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3)

secondaryOutcome.outcome:
Quality of Life Questionnaires: 36-Item Short Form Survey; patient-reported survey of patient health. Scoring general health and pain.
Multiple Sclerosis Spasticity Scale; measure the impact of spasticity in multiple sclerosis
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2), Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3) and Visit 7 (drop out visit),

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Insomnia Severity Index Sleep Survey; for the evaluation of insomnia
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Day 15 (Visit 2, day -1 Run-in Period 1), Day 29 (Visit 3, Day 14 of Run-in Period 1), Day 43 (Visit 4, end Cross-over Period 2), Day 64 (Visit 6, Day 14 of Cross-over Period 3) and Visit 7 (drop out visit),

trial_design.concealment: central randomization by computer generated list held by unblinded pharmacist
trial_design.sequence: Computerized randomisation scheme created by study statistician
trial_design.designfeatures: 80 participants will be recruited and will be randomly allocated to receive beverage in a crossover manner.

recruitment.hospital: Brain and Mind Centre - University of Sydney - Camperdown
Royal Melbourne Hospital - City campus - Parkville
John Hunter Hospital Royal Newcastle Centre - New Lambton

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Prudential Tower 800 Boylston St 24th Floor, Boston MA 02199

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Prudential Tower 800 Boylston St. 24th Floor, Boston MA 02199

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study aims to evaluate the effects and safety of FLX-787 in patients with MS who experience muscle cramps and spasms. We aim to assess the effect of FLX-787 on muscle spasms/cramps. FLX-787 is self administered morning and evening. Flex Pharma hypothesizes that activating Transient Receptor Potential (TRP) ion channels, which are known to exist in primary sensory neurons in the mouth, oesophagus and gut increase inhibitory tone in the spinal cord and prevents repetitive firing of alpha neurons thereby relieving the cramp. This study investigates whether the ingredients in FLX-787 activate the TRP ion channels relieve muscle cramps in paitents with MS
